thread.title: Shuttle service starts Friday in Dayton's Oregon District
thread.title_full: Shuttle service starts Friday in Dayton's Oregon District | www.daytondailynews.com

author: Ty Greenlees
title: Shuttle service starts Friday in Dayton's Oregon District
text:
People struggling to find parking in the Oregon District will have another option beginning tonight.
Visitors can park at a discounted rate of $3 at the Transportation Center Garage, located at the corner of 5th St. and Jefferson St. between The Neon movie theater and the Convention Center, and take a free shuttle into the Oregon District. The hop-on, hop-off shuttle has six stops in the district, as well as a stop at the Transportation Center Garage.
“We want to be able to actually move customers around the district so they can experience multiple business in the district,” said Michael Martin, president of the Oregon District Business Association.
Parking has become a problem over the years as the Oregon District’s first-floor retail occupancy rate grew to more than 95%.
“It’s been difficult for my patrons on Friday and Saturday evenings, and during the week,” Jay’s Seafood Restaurant owner Amy Haverstick told this paper back in July when the program had not yet been approved. “The parking lot fills up very quickly.”
Employees at Oregon District businesses will get to park for free at the Transportation Center Garage.
The Oregon District Business association has partnered with The Downtown Dayton Partnership, City of Dayton, ABM Parking Services, and Citywide Development Corp. to offer the parking and shuttle program.
Drivers said they didn’t want to park at the Convention Center and walk under a dark bridge, which is why the groups are offering a shuttle, though “that bridge is now all very well lit and the garage is well lit,” according to Downtown Dayton Partnership President Sandy Gudorf.
Julie Eisenhauer said she’s interested in using the new program.
“I wouldn’t have to spend 10 minutes following people to their cars when they’re about to leave,” she said.
The discounted parking and free shuttle is available Friday and Saturday from 5 p.m. to 1 a.m.
The Oregon District Business Association will pay $35,000 annually for the shuttle, but they hope to find a sponsor.
Staff writer Kate Bartley contributed to this report.
